{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3715844,"name":"FredK","username":"FredK","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/71e660/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-08-15T13:29:41.181Z","cooked":"

And not in a good way.
Bought the load tester https://www.harborfreight.com/100-amp-612v-battery-load-tester-61747.html crimped the 3 wires on each cable together into an SB-50, rechecked everything an absurd number of times, even had a ME professor take a look, and on the first test it started emitting smoke about 5 seconds in. Rechecked everything, read through the manual again. Have searched here and there but can’t find any stories of similar problems or why. This usually means there’s something ridiculously simple that we’re missing but we can’t figure it out. Any thoughts?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-08-26T17:36:00.925Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":82,"reads":236,"readers_count":235,"score":472.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":505331,"topic_slug":"cen-tech-battery-load-tester-is-smoking","display_username":"FredK","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.harborfreight.com/100-amp-612v-battery-load-tester-61747.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":37},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/first-hot-takes/502031/823","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"FIRST hot takes","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31768,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/cen-tech-battery-load-tester-is-smoking/505331/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3715846,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-15T13:50:36.587Z","cooked":"

Do you have any pictures?

Did you ensure the selector switch was in the 12V position for robot or modern automotive batteries? If the switch is in the 6V position it may be using only a portion of the heating element and you may be overloading it.

The linked tester is basically a low Ω wire that gets HOT. I would not be surprised to see moderate smoke out of the vent holes originating at the heating element because of:

  1. initial use. Burn off any contaminants from the manufacturing/heating element handling process. Subsequent uses show little to no smoke.
  2. User contamination. If oil was splashed, something fell into the holes, it sat on the shelf and gathered a layer of dust on it, etc…Once heated it will get HOT and burn off those contaminants.

If the smoke is coming from the cables/wires/anywhere else than the heating element then I would consider that unexpected.

Additionally this unit is for intermittent use only (don’t expect it to run more than a few seconds, if you are trying to test for minuets you will need a different tool or expect this one to burn up quickly). There should also be a cool-down period between tests or after noticing its getting too hot.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-08-15T15:19:17.360Z","reply_count":4,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":226,"readers_count":225,"score":155.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":505331,"topic_slug":"cen-tech-battery-load-tester-is-smoking","display_username":"Joseph Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/cen-tech-battery-load-tester-is-smoking/505331/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3715851,"name":"FredK","username":"FredK","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/71e660/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-08-15T14:01:36.410Z","cooked":"

Thank you.

Do you have any pictures? Will add one of the whole unit, but can take more if needed.

Did you ensure the selector switch was in the 12V position for robot or modern automotive batteries? If the switch is in the 6V position it may be using only a portion of the heating element and you may be overloading it.

We thought of this but cannot find anywhere that there is a way to switch between 6 and 12v.

If the smoke is coming from the cables/wires/anywhere else than the heating element then I would consider that unexpected.

It appeared to be coming from the top of the unit, but it was hard to see.

Additionally this unit is for intermittent use only (don’t expect it to run more than a few seconds, if you are trying to test for minuets you will need a different tool or expect this one to burn up quickly). There should also be a cool-down period between tests or after noticing its getting too hot.

We were careful to follow the use guidelines (10 sec test and 3 minutes between tests). This happened 5 seconds into the first use.

I’m hoping it was just due to being the first use.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-08-15T14:02:16.272Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":203,"readers_count":202,"score":80.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":505331,"topic_slug":"cen-tech-battery-load-tester-is-smoking","display_username":"FredK","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63541,"username":"Jwal","name":"Joseph Walters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31768,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/cen-tech-battery-load-tester-is-smoking/505331/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3715855,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-15T14:09:36.985Z","cooked":"

Not to be that guy, but we are talking about a load tester from Harbor Freight, which is not exactly an establishment known for its quality products.

Beyond that though, @Jwal makes a good point. Given the nature of load testers, I wouldn’t be shocked to see this kind of thing happen on first use as it burns off residue. My suggestion would be to test it again outside where you have some space for ventilation and in case it catches fire, maybe use an older battery you don’t care about anymore just in case.

If the issue persists or gets worse while using it according to the directions, I would discard/return it (if they let you) and buy a better quality tester from somewhere else.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-08-15T14:10:54.009Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":185,"readers_count":184,"score":77.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":505331,"topic_slug":"cen-tech-battery-load-tester-is-smoking","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/cen-tech-battery-load-tester-is-smoking/505331/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3715856,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-15T14:14:48.476Z","cooked":"
FredK:

This happened 5 seconds into the first use.

Yea, my money is on initial burn-off - if there’s any oils from manufacturing (there almost always are), that 1200W of heat will make them burn pretty quickly, and it’ll take longer than 5 seconds for them to go away. Probably closer to three or four cycles, at least.

Casserole had the same model for a while, used it occasionally. Even after it was broken it, it always had that “burnt dust” smell whenever we used it, and super fast too.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-08-15T14:14:48.476Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":171,"readers_count":170,"score":99.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":505331,"topic_slug":"cen-tech-battery-load-tester-is-smoking","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/cen-tech-battery-load-tester-is-smoking/505331/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3715858,"name":"Nate Laverdure (he/him)","username":"Nate_Laverdure","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nate_laverdure/{size}/134005_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-15T14:22:39.828Z","cooked":"
Jwal:

Did you ensure the selector switch was in the 12V position for robot or modern automotive batteries? If the switch is in the 6V position it may be using only a portion of the heating element and you may be overloading it.

For this model, I don’t think there is a switch to toggle between 6 & 12V modes… Instead, you read the separate scales on the gauge.

image521×575 75.4 KB

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-08-15T14:23:38.523Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":163,"readers_count":162,"score":77.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":505331,"topic_slug":"cen-tech-battery-load-tester-is-smoking","display_username":"Nate Laverdure (he/him)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":4999,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Cynicism isn't wisdom"},"post_url":"/t/cen-tech-battery-load-tester-is-smoking/505331/6","custom_user_title":"Cynicism isn't wisdom","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3715874,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-15T14:39:12.600Z","cooked":"

1293 also has the Cen-Tech tester. And yeah, it’s just a separate part of the gauge markings for 6V.

I faintly recall some “very hot equipment” smell the first time we ran ours, but it’s run fine since. I wouldn’t blame OP for doing the next couple tests in a place safer for handling an overcooked unit just in case, though.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-08-15T16:14:41.446Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":73.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":505331,"topic_slug":"cen-tech-battery-load-tester-is-smoking","display_username":"Adam Fleming","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":63541,"username":"Jwal","name":"Joseph Walters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41952,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 3596 Lead Mentor/Alum, FTC 30607 Lead Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/cen-tech-battery-load-tester-is-smoking/505331/9","custom_user_title":"FRC 3596 Lead Mentor/Alum, FTC 30607 Lead Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3715953,"name":"FredK","username":"FredK","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/71e660/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-08-15T16:53:24.333Z","cooked":"

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-08-15T16:53:24.333Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":115,"readers_count":114,"score":43.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":505331,"topic_slug":"cen-tech-battery-load-tester-is-smoking","display_username":"FredK","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":41952,"username":"AdamF","name":"Adam Fleming","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adamf/{size}/234717_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31768,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/cen-tech-battery-load-tester-is-smoking/505331/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3715983,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-15T17:40:21.711Z","cooked":"

Having torn one of these all the way down, and converted two for FRC use…

Yes, there is only the on/off switch.
6 Volt vs 12 Volt is read on the meter. 6 Volt batteries pull around 50 Amps.

OMG yes they reek the first time you power up. And they continue to smell like disturbing hot metal. That resistor gets hot PDQ!

Here’s all the working parts for your delectation… Tightening up the nuts on the resistor is a smart idea if you DO open it up. Note that a panel mount SB50 will ONLY fit on the -side-. Not the bottom, where I tried to install it the first time. oops. The meter has a full bridge rectifier on it made with discrete diodes. There are a couple of surface mount resistors that I don’t think are actually used, and an adjustment pot. I did not explore the circuit past the point of confirming that you don’t need to pay any attention to + and - on the leads…

image1300×828 133 KB

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-08-15T17:40:21.711Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":110,"readers_count":109,"score":57.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":505331,"topic_slug":"cen-tech-battery-load-tester-is-smoking","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/cen-tech-battery-load-tester-is-smoking/505331/11","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3716011,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-15T18:27:44.556Z","cooked":"
Jwal:

don’t expect it to run more than a few seconds

Specifically from the manual:

Test Cycle
10 seconds per test with
1 minute cool down;
3 tests in 5 minutes
